title: The Black Mikado
description:
<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Black_Mikado" rel="nofollow" target="_NEW">http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Black_Mikado</a>

The Black Mikado is a musical comedy, based on Gilbert and Sullivan's The Mikado,[1] adapted by Janos Bajtala, George Larnyoh and Eddie Quansah from W. S. Gilbert's original 1885 libretto and Arthur Sullivan's score. The show premiered on 24 April 1975 at the Cambridge Theatre in London, where it ran for 472 performances before going on a national tour. A 1976 production was mounted in Soweto, South Africa, where it played at the Diepkloof Hall.[2] After this, the musical was not revived
